This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
I had the same issue on Android about 2 weeks ago. Don't know if it's still an issue since I was banned for saying "you think about orange man too much, see a doctor for possible TDS diagnosis". Banned forever from a site I'd been paying for for years for my first ever comment lol. 

Apparently if you contact support about appealing a ban and they don't like your appeal they will ban you from contacting support so I got banned from that too because I said "If you look at the comments before mine in the thread it's very clear I was joking.  Also TDS is not a real medical condition.  Other reported comments that are genuinely vile and against TOS are still up, even ones calling for violence so I don't understand why a single joke has led to this.  Not even a warning..."

So I vote to block the site completely because it's full of hate speech, racism and calls to violence and is unsafe for human eyes if you look at the comments of an image in the main need. 

ðŸ˜

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://downdetector.com/status/youtube/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdowndetector.com%2Fstatus%2Fyoutube%2F) ### Comment Username: @d0x360 > The social media feed is also missing. Adding the following brings the comments section back but I don't think it should be blocked anyway... > > @@||downdetectorapi.com/v2/companies/*/messages/current$domain=downdetectorapi.com > > The wildcard is the site identifier (YouTube in this case) which is a string of numbers so a wildcard seemed easier than adding every site I might check in the future but I don't know why disqus is blocked. > > I understand it can be used to track but it seems like blocking it should be the user rule instead of unblocking since it's not on most websites. > > ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.computerbase.de/2022-12/the-witcher-3-next-gen-update-benchmarks/#diagramm-frametimes-mittel-preset-2560-1440](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.computerbase.de%2F2022-12%2Fthe-witcher-3-next-gen-update-benchmarks%2F%23diagramm-frametimes-mittel-preset-2560-1440) ### Comment Username: @tox1c90 > Something is breaking the dynamic/interactive parts of the page when Adguard is enabled. > > The Computerbase logo (top left) does not resize properly when scrolling down from the top of the page. > More severe: The buttons of the benchmark tables (click on the different resolutions) do not work, neither all the other interactive stuff (e.g., hovering with cursor over the results) ### Screenshots

comment.body:
It seems that it's related to this issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/issues/264 and it occurs only in nightly/beta build.
I hope that it will be fixed soon.

As a temporary solution, adding this rule:
```adblock
computerbase.de#@%#//scriptlet('prevent-element-src-loading', 'img', 'pagead2.googlesyndication.com')
```
to user rules should fix this issue.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
